Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched 6 1/3 innings with 86 pitches, striking out four and giving up only one hit, two walks.
Freddie Freeman hit a home run in the third inning of Game 2.
Teoscar Hernandez and Tommy Edman also went deep for the Dodgers.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers are now two wins away from a World Series title.
Shohei Ohtani exited the game due to an apparent shoulder injury and will undergo further testing.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Dodger Stadium.
The series will shift to New York for Game 3 on Monday.
Others: Aaron Judge went 0-for-4 with three strikeouts in Game 2.
Juan Soto delivered the Yankees' first two hits of the game, including a home run.
